reporter_caption.center: TRUMAN v. DIV. OF FAMILY SRVS., 784 A.2d 1082 (Del. 2001)

caption.center: KELLY TRUMAN and MARTIN HENRY, Respondents Below-Appellants v. DIVISION
OF FAMILY SERVICES and CASA Petitioners Below-Appellees.

opinion.posture: Court Below: Family Court of the State of Delaware in and for Sussex County File No. 99-12-05 TPR
opinion.opinion_text:
AFFIRMED.
Unpublished opinion is below.
KELLY TRUMAN and MARTIN HENRY, Respondents Below-Appellants v. DIVISION OF FAMILY SERVICES and CASA Petitioners Below-Appellees. No. 80, 2001 Supreme Court of the State of Delaware. Submitted: October 10, 2001 Decided: October 19, 2001
Before VEASEY, Chief Justice, WALSH and STEELE, Justices.
ORDER This 19th day of October, upon consideration of the briefs of the parties, it appears to the Court that the judgment of the Family Court should be affirmed on the basis of and for the reasons set forth in its decision dated January 22, 2001.
NOW, THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the Family Court is AFFIRMED. BY THE COURT:
